snippet: Immigrant service providers and government officials are moving to forestall an expected rise in immigration fraud ahead of President Obama’s executive action.
abstract: Immigrant service providers and government officials are moving to forestall expected rise in immigration fraud ahead of Pres Obama’s executive actions that will offer millions of undocumented immigrants a reprieve from deportation; they fear a rise in shoddy lawyers promising to accelerate application process, in exchange for thousands of dollars.
lead_paragraph: Immigrant service providers and government officials are moving to forestall an expected rise in immigration fraud ahead of President Obama’s executive action.

headline.main: Preparing for Immigration Reform, and Warning of Potential Fraud
headline.print_headline: Preparing for Immigration Reform, and Warning of Potential Fraud
